description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, July, 1, 2024

description: Michael J. Fox makes a surprise appearance at the Glastonbury Music Festival, in Somerset, England, joining Coldplay onstage.
title: Michael J. Fox makes surprise appearance at Coldplay performance

description: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that former President Donald Trump is entitled to immunity from federal prosecution for official actions he took while in office. Jan Crawford reports on the landmark decision and Bob Costa has more on reaction from the Trump campaign.
title: Presidents have immunity for official acts in office, Supreme Court rules

description: President Biden narrowly won Wisconsin in 2020. CBS News campaign reporter Shawna Mizelle spoke with voters there to see if they're still sticking with Biden in 2024.
title: Democratic voters respond to Biden's debate performance

description: The Supreme Court's landmark decision ruled that Trump is immune from prosecution for official acts he took while in office.
title: Watch Live: Biden to deliver remarks on Supreme Court's ruling on Trump immunity case

description: In former President Donald Trump's immunity claim, three Supreme Court justices issued a blistering dissent Monday, penned by Justice Sonia Sotomayor. Thomas Dupree, former U.S. deputy assistant attorney general, joins "America Decides" with analysis. Then, Shelby Talcott, politics reporter for Semafor, and Brakkton Booker, national political correspondent for Politico, join with more.
title: Justice Sotomayor says Trump immunity ruling sets dangerous precedent

description: Enjoy clearer vision with new prescription eyeglasses or sunglasses during Zenni Optical's 4th of July sale.
title: Save up to 75% on glasses at the Zenni Optical 4th of July sale

description: President Biden's family is urging him to stay in the 2024 race as top Democrats close ranks around the president after his debate performance last week. Democratic strategist Ashley Etienne joins "America Decides" to discuss what elected Democrats are saying about the top of the ticket.
title: Top Democrats rally around Biden after debate performance

description: When then-President Lyndon B. Johnson announced he would not run again in 1968, it rocked American politics. With President Biden facing calls to step aside after his debate performance, it's still unclear whether he will have an LBJ moment of his own. Presidential historian Douglas Brinkley joins to discuss.
title: Will Biden have a Lyndon B. Johnson moment and bow out?

description: According to a new CBS News poll, 72% of registered voters say President Biden does not have the mental and cognitive health to serve after the debate with former President Donald Trump. CBS News' Anthony Salvanto and Weijia Jiang join with more.
title: Most voters questioning Biden's ability to serve after debate, poll finds

description: A landmark ruling from the Supreme Court on Monday says a president has "absolute immunity" from prosecution when it comes to official acts. The interpretation of what constitutes an official act is still up for debate. CBS News' Jan Crawford and Scott MacFarlane join "America Decides" to discuss.
title: Examining the fallout from Supreme Court's Trump immunity ruling

description: Hurricane Beryl ripped doors, windows and roofs in homes across the southeast Caribbean after making landfall on the island of Carriacou as a Category 4.
title: Hurricane Beryl leaves damage strewn across southeast Caribbean islands

description: Rep. Victoria Spartz is facing a weapons charge after her office confirmed she had an unloaded handgun in her suitcase while going through security at a Virginia airport.
title: Indiana Rep. Victoria Spartz charged with weapons violation at Virginia airport

description: Some airports are reporting delays for Americans hoping to travel before the Independence Day holiday weekend rush. CBS News Philadelphia's Nikki Dementri has more on the crowds at Philadelphia International Airport.
title: Travel delays before July 4th holiday

description: Advisers on former President Donald Trump's 2024 campaign believe the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential immunity will help his efforts for a second term at the White House and make another trial unlikely before Election Day. CBS News' political director Fin Gomez reports.
title: Supreme Court's presidential immunity ruling and Trump's 2024 campaign

description: France's far-right party, National Rally, took a strong lead in the first round of the country's legislative elections, according to polling projections. CBS News' Eliane Cobbe is in Paris and breaks down the reaction.
title: France's far-right takes lead in first round of snap election

description: Jonathan Kaye's attorney claims he was "terrorized" before throwing punch at a woman in June in Brooklyn.
title: Former banker seen punching woman is arrested on assault charges

description: Chicken Soup for the Soul, which once surged on the strength of nurturing content, tumbled deeper into debt after buying DVD provider Redbox.
title: Chicken Soup for the Soul, awash in debt, declares bankruptcy

description: Charlotte, a stingray at a North Carolina aquarium, made national news after the discovery she was pregnant even though there were no male stingrays in her tank.
title: Stingray that went viral after mysterious pregnancy has died, aquarium says

description: California law takes effect today amid partisan divide over firearms that killed more than 48,000 Americans in 2022.
title: Gun policy debate now includes retail tracking codes in California

description: Hurricane Beryl battered the Caribbean island of Carriacou in Grenada as a powerful Category 4 storm. Beryl is expected to move across the southeastern and central Caribbean next. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has the latest.
title: Hurricane Beryl makes landfall as Category 4 storm

description: Legendary rapper Flavor Flav joins USA Water Polo national teams as the official hype man, bringing energy, support, and unexpected surprises to the athletes.
title: Meet USA Water Polo's newest hype man, Flavor Flav

description: The Israeli army ordered a mass evacuation of Palestinians from much of Khan Younis on Monday, a sign that troops are likely to launch a new ground assault.
title: Israel orders Palestinians to flee southern Gaza city of Khan Younis

description: Concerns over President Biden's health during a potential second term in the White House appeared to increase in a recent CBS News poll conducted after last week's presidential debate. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Biden campaign brushes off age worries after debate performance

description: Teen running star Quincy Wilson will get his chance to represent the United States in Paris after getting the call to join the Olympic track team.
title: 16-year-old Quincy Wilson becomes youngest U.S. male track Olympian ever

description: New York Attorney General Letitia James's office is investigating a Utica Police encounter with Nyah Mway, a 13-year-old boy who appeared to aim a BB gun at officers that looked like an actual firearm, according to police.  Mway was shot and killed by one of the officers after a foot chase. CBS News' Michael George reports.
title: New York investigating Utica police stop after 13-year-old boy was killed

description: The next inflation report could affect the value of a gold investment. Here's why you should act before that happens.
title: Why you should invest in gold before the July inflation report's released

description: Former President Donald Trump called the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential immunity a "big win for our Constitution and democracy" on social media Monday. The high court ruled Trump is entitled to immunity for official acts he took while president. CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen breaks down Trump's response, and Scott Fredericksen, a former federal prosecutor, joins CBS News with more on the ruling's dissents.
title: Trump calls Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity a win

description: A Florida judge has released the transcripts of a 2006 grand jury investigation that looked into sex trafficking and rape allegations made against wealthy and infamous financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Florida judge calls Epstein the "most infamous pedophile in American history" following probe transcripts release

description: The Supreme Court's ruling extending presidential immunity to Donald Trump for official actions he took while in office will impact how special counsel Jack Smith handles his prosecution of the former president. CBS News' Jan Crawford, Scott Macfarlane and Jessica Levinson break down what will happen next.
title: Supreme Court ruling on Donald Trump immunity impacts Jack Smith's case

description: Supreme Court rules former President Trump is entitled to some immunity; Jury enters Day 5 of deliberations in Karen Read murder trial.
title: 7/1: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Looking for an inexpensive credit option? Here's why you should turn to your home equity this July.
title: 3 reasons to access your home equity this July

description: It's a robot vacuum and mop all-in-one. Take advantage of this early Prime Day deal before it disappears.
title: Early Prime Day deal: Save $299 on a robot vacuum and mop combo

description: So-called personality hires can bring real value to companies, but are sometimes resented by co-workers.
title: What's a personality hire? Here's the value they bring to the workplace.

description: Karen Read's murder trial has ended in a mistrial after a hung jury said deep divisions left them unable to reach a verdict. Read was accused in the 2022 killing of Boston police officer John O'Keefe, her boyfriend at the time. CBS News Boston's Penny Kmitt reports.
title: Mistrial in Karen Read murder trial

description: Those looking to have dessert-inspired ramen can now try s'mores Cup Noodles.
title: Instant ramen now comes in a surprising dessert flavor

description: Debt forgiveness can help you get rid of your debt for less than you owe. Here's how to tell if it's right for you.
title: Is credit card debt forgiveness the best option for you? 5 ways to decide

description: The Karen Read murder trial ended Monday after a "starkly divided" hung jury failed to reach a verdict, forcing Judge Beverly Cannone to declare a mistrial.
title: Watch Live: Karen Read trial ends in mistrial with "deeply divided" hung jury

description: How to grab the 2024 edition of Samsung's Frame TV for all your 4th of July celebrations at an affordable price.
title: The 2024 Samsung Frame TV is on sale for 4th of July

description: If you have limited laundry room space, there are a variety of stacked washer and dryer units that are perfect.
title: The 5 best stackable washers and dryers in 2024

description: Steve Bannon, who served as a strategist for former President Donald Trump, reported to federal prison in Danbury, Connecticut, on Monday to serve a four-month sentence for defying a House committee subpoena related to the attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. CBS News' Nikki Battiste reports.
title: Steve Bannon reports to prison

description: After the debate prompted concern among Democrats about President Biden's fitness for a second term, his campaign is pushing forward and his family is encouraging him to stay in the race.
title: After struggling in debate, Biden's campaign resolute, family urges him to stay in

description: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that former presidents are entitled to immunity from federal prosecution for official acts. Here's what that means for former President Donald Trump.
title: What comes next after the Supreme Court's Trump immunity ruling

description: Are you thinking about signing up for an AARP membership? Here are 12 benefits for those over 50.
title: 12 AARP benefits those over 50 should know

description: House Republicans want audio recordings of President Biden's interview with special counsel Robert Hur as part of their impeachment inquiry.
title: House Republicans sue Garland, seeking Biden audio

description: Discover the eight best electric dryers in 2024 from brands like Samsung, LG, GE and Whirlpool.
title: The 8 best electric dryers for 2024

description: Debt consolidation can be a smart approach to credit card debt, but there are important questions to ask first.
title: 6 crucial questions to ask before consolidating your credit card debt

description: In a surprise appearance, Michael J. Fox joined Coldplay at the Glastonbury Festival in England on Saturday. Frontman Chris Martin introduced the actor, who joined in on the songs "Fix You" and "Humankind."
title: Michael J. Fox plays guitar with Coldplay at Glastonbury Festival in surprise appearance

description: Simone Biles was again crowned all-around champion at the U.S. Olympic gymnastics trials over the weekend as her quest for gold continues after dropping out of most of her events in Tokyo three years ago. Les Carpenter, an Olympics reporter for The Washington Post, joined CBS News to discuss Biles and other noteworthy Olympics news.
title: Simone Biles wins all-around title at U.S. Gymnastics trials, setting stage for Olympics

description: Looking for an easy way to grow your money this July? Here are three options to consider now.
title: 3 easy ways to boost your savings this July

description: The United States is now the world's leading exporter of liquified natural gas, or LNG, after the country tripled its output in the past six years, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Some environmentalists say this is defeating the Biden administration's goals of weaning us off fossil fuels to avert climate change-driven catastrophe in the future.
title: Environmental impact of U.S. as world's biggest exporter of liquefied natural gas

description: More than 300 medicines​ are in short supply, including treatments for the side effects of chemotherapy, which can hugely affect a patient's recovery. Here's how.
title: How drug shortages can make or break a patient's recovery

description: Pharmacists are sounding the alarm as more than 300 medicines, including treatments for the side effects of chemotherapy, are in short supply. CBS News' Skyler Henry learned how the shortages can make or break a patient's recovery.
title: Essential drugs, including treatments for chemo side effects, in short supply

description: There are eight operating LNG export terminals in the U.S., with seven more under construction. The unprecedented boom is worrying climate activists.
title: Environmental impact of liquefied natural gas as U.S. is top supplier

description: Steve Bannon had to report to prison after the Supreme Court rejected his plea to stay out.
title: Steve Bannon reports to prison in Connecticut

description: The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 Monday that former President Donald Trump and all presidents are entitled to immunity claims against criminal prosecutions for official acts undertaken in office. The three liberal justices wrote in their dissent that the decision "reshapes the institution of the presidency." Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman has more on the dissent and a potential timeline for Trump's election interference trial.
title: Examining the scathing dissent in Trump immunity case, potential Jan. 6 trial timeline

description: Wells Fargo tests dozens of burrito bowls from Chipotle Mexican Grill amid social media complaints about skimpy servings.
title: Chipotle's portion sizes can vary by up to 87%, analysis finds

description: The Supreme Court ruled Monday that presidents have immunity from criminal prosecution for official actions undertaken in office, a decision that will likely prevent former President Donald Turmp's election interference case from going to trial before the November election. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen, CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson, CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes, and attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman dive into the details of the ruling.
title: Breaking down the Supreme Court's Trump immunity ruling

description: Pope Francis has formally signed off on the canonization of Carlo Acutis, who will become the first-ever saint from the millennial generation.
title: Pope approves canonization of Catholicism's first-ever millennial saint

description: Voters in France have stunned President Emmanuel Macron with a historic defeat in the first round of voting for a new parliament. Macron's centrist party finished third, behind supporters of the left and right, with Marine Le Pen's far-right party taking first place. The second and final round of voting takes place next Sunday. CBS News foreign correspondent Elaine Cobb has more from Paris.
title: Far-right nationalist party leads after first round of French elections

description: The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 that presidents have immunity for official actions in office, giving former President Donald Trump some protections from criminal prosecution and likely postponing his election interference trial until after the November election. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen, CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford, CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes, CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson, CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa, and attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman have analysis of the decision.
title: Inside the Supreme Court's decision granting Trump some immunity

description: COVID-19 cases are surging across the U.S. with the CDC saying a new variant is growing or likely growing in 43 states. Dr. William Schaffner, a professor at the Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, joined CBS News to talk about the rise in cases.
title: Summer wave of COVID-19 hitting U.S.

description: Construction engineer Joey Chestnut found his true calling when he became a competitive eater; he would go on to win the Nathan's Famous International Hot Dog Eating Contest at Coney Island 16 times since 2007. In this profile that originally aired on "CBS Sunday Morning" on July 4, 2010, correspondent Bill Geist talks with Chestnut about what he would (or would not) eat; with Joey's mother, Alicia, about his childhood love of hot dogs and macaroni & cheese; and with George Shea, chairman of Major League Eating, who calls Chestnut "the greatest eater in history."
title: From the archives: The Joey Chestnut Story

description: Minnesota's Mall of America will begin using facial recognition technology after a series of recent gun-related incidents. Security teams have installed cameras that can map faces and detect potential threats. Jamil Jaffer, founder and executive director of the National Security Institute, joined CBS News to discuss the move.
title: Mall of America adds facial recognition technology

description: Shop big 4th of July sales and save on TVs, outdoor furniture, outdoor grills and more now.
title: All the best 4th of July sales you can shop right now

description: The U.S. Department of Justice is reportedly pressuring Boeing to plead guilty to criminal fraud in two deadly crashes involving its 737 Max jets. The plea deal was presented on Sunday. Meanwhile, overnight, Boeing announced it would buy back Spirit AeroSystems, which builds fuselages and other significant parts for both Boeing and Airbus.
title: Boeing announces plans to acquire Spirit AeroSystems amid possible plea deal with DOJ

description: Residents of Utica, New York, are expressing their anger and calling for answers after 13-year-old Nyah Mway was shot and killed by police Friday. CBS News correspondent Michael George reports.
title: Utica residents, family members call for answers after 13-year-old killed by police

description: People in the Windward Islands of the Caribbean are bracing for destructive conditions Monday as Hurricane Beryl continues its track west. CBS News correspondent Cristian Benavides has more.
title: Hurricane Beryl closing in on Caribbean as Category 4 storm

description: The meme-stock investor bought more than 9 million shares of the online pet supply company, causing its stock to surge.
title: Keith "Roaring Kitty" Gill buys $245 million stake in Chewy

description: The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 that presidents have immunity for official actions in office, giving former President Donald Trump a partial win and likely delaying his election interference trial to after the November election. Major Garrett anchored CBS News' special report.
title: Supreme Court gives Trump a win, rules presidents have immunity for official acts in office

description: Israeli forces had detained Al-Shifa hospital boss Mohammed Abu Selmia and said Hamas was using the facility as a commander center.
title: Israel frees Gaza hospital boss after 7-month detention without charge

description: There are a few reasons you may want to lock in a rate on a long-term CD now. Here's what to know.
title: Is now the best time to lock in a long-term CD?

description: A new poll from CBS News has found that 72% of registered voters don't think President Biden should be running for reelection after last week's debate against former President Donald Trump, but Biden's campaign appears set to soldier on. Over the weekend, prominent Democrats voiced their support for the president while Biden's family pushed for him to stay in the race. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden's family encourages him to stay in race, Democrats close ranks after debate

description: It was "f---ing mind-blowing," the "Back to the Future" actor posted about his appearance with the band at the Glastonbury Festival.
title: Michael J. Fox makes surprise appearance with Coldplay

description: CBS News poll shows 72% of registered voters feel President Biden should not be running again; Mall of America adds facial recognition technology.
title: 7/1: CBS Morning News

description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates soon. Here's why some experts say that may be good for gold's price.
title: Why the expected interest rate cut could be good for gold

description: Dick Kazan is dedicated to sharing a simple message that makes a big difference in people's daily lives, but he didn't always have that perspective.
title: Man's simple greeting every school morning leaves lasting impact

description: First-round French election results show massive gains for far-right, drawing a warning of a possible "very dangerous" outcome for Europe.
title: Macron calls on French voters to thwart far-right in election round-two

description: Golf's traditional attire is getting a makeover thanks to Eastside Golf. Jericka Duncan talks to the brand's co-founders to learn how their stylish apparel is attracting a more diverse crowd to the sport.
title: From khaki pants to cutting-edge fashion, Eastside Golf is changing how players dress and feel

description: Legendary rapper Flavor Flav has signed on as the hype man for USA Water Polo for its women's Olympic team. His role as an official hype man includes multiple appearances annually at USA Water Polo events and exclusive social media collaborations. Flavor Flav and Maggie Steffens, U.S. women's water polo captain, join "CBS Mornings" to talk about their collaboration.
title: Flavor Flav on why he's helping sponsor U.S. women's water polo team

description: At 79, Dick Kazan greets everyone with a smile and a fist bump. Once solely driven by money, Kazan's late-life realization transformed him into a beacon of positivity in his community. Now, he shares his wisdom in his newsletter, "Kazan Today," offering insights on self-confidence, community and fulfillment.
title: Meet the crossing guard who brings joy to one California neighbohood

description: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that former President Donald Trump is entitled to immunity from federal prosecution for official actions he took while in office.
title: Supreme Court says Trump has immunity for official acts in landmark ruling

description: The Supreme Court was reviewing the constitutionality of laws regulating social media companies from Texas and Florida.
title: Supreme Court orders new look at Texas, Florida social media laws

description: President Biden and his allies push back against calls for him to drop out of the 2024 presidential race after last week's shaky debate performance. Also, Caribbean islands scramble to prepare for Hurricane Beryl. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: President Biden and allies reject calls for him to drop out of 2024 race

description: Voters in France are selecting a new legislature. In the first round of voting, President Emmanuel Macron's centrist party suffered a big defeat, finishing third behind supporters of the left and right. The second and final round of voting wraps up on July 7.
title: Macron's centrist party suffers historic defeat in first round of voting in France

description: Experts weigh in on whether home prices will finally fall this summer due to pent-up demand and low housing supply.
title: Will home prices finally drop this summer? Here's what experts say

description: Body cam video shows the moments leading up to a police shooting that killed a 13-year-old boy in Utica, New York. Police say Nyah Mway ran from officers during a stop Friday night and pointed what appeared to be a gun that later was confirmed to be a pellet gun. Community members are now demanding accountability. (Warning: Some viewers may find these images disturbing.)
title: Community demands accountability after 13-year-old killed in police shooting in Utica, New York

description: Border Patrol processed approximately 84,000 migrants in June, the lowest monthly level since President Biden took office.
title: Illegal border crossings fall to lowest level of Biden's presidency

description: The Supreme Court is releasing its final list of opinions before going on summer break. One of the last major cases to be decided is whether former President Donald Trump is shielded from criminal charges for alleged crimes he committed while in office.
title: Supreme Court to release Trump immunity opinion in final major case of the term

description: Israel has reportedly released dozens of Palestinians it detained from Gaza, including the director of Gaza's main hospital, Al-Shifa Hospital, which the IDF raided twice. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more.
title: Israel reportedly releases dozens of Palestinian detainees

description: A new CBS News poll has found that 72% of registered voters feel President Biden should not be running for reelection following his rough performance in last week's debate against former President Donald Trump. Despite that, Biden's family spent the weekend encouraging him to stay in the race. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro has more.
title: 72% of voters don't think Biden should be running for president, but campaign moves forward

description: Public health officials came armed with a serious message for Pride Month: Get vaccinated against mpox.
title: Advocates urge mpox vaccines with cases on the rise

description: Coco Gauff, Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz, Iga Swiatek are set to compete at Wimbledon. Find out how to watch.
title: How to watch Wimbledon 2024 today

description: Hurricane Beryl has been fluctuating between a Category 3 and Category 4, producing life-threatening conditions as it heads toward the Windward Islands in the Caribbean. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has more.
title: Hurricane Beryl an "extremely dangerous" storm with Caribbean in its sights

description: Will Smith made a return to the stage at the BET Awards, performing his new single "You Can Make It," which alludes to redemption. It's the rapper's first new music release in seven years as he tries to comeback from the infamous Oscar slap two years ago. Meanwhile, Usher was honored at the show with the lifetime achievement award.
title: Stars shine at BET Awards as Usher is honored, Will Smith debuts song

description: President Biden sought to reassure voters with energetic campaign stops in Atlanta, Raleigh and New York following his shaky debate performance last week. However, a new CBS News poll show voters have serious concerns about the president's mental and cognitive health.
title: New CBS News poll shows voter concern after shaky Biden debate performance

description: Fallout from ransomeware attack continues to affect car dealerships as CDK Global gradually restores service.
title: CDK's car dealer software still not fully restored after cyberattack

description: The Netherlands Volleyball Federation says Steven van de Velde has shown "self-insight and reflection" since his 2016 conviction for raping a 12-year-old.
title: Dutch volleyball player in Olympics 8 years after child rape conviction

description: The judge warned defense lawyers last week that telling jurors alleged details about Nadine Menendez's ex-boyfriend risks turning the trial "into a soap opera."
title: Defense witnesses in Sen. Bob Menendez's bribery trial to begin testimony

description: As Hurricane Beryl closed in on the southeastern Caribbean, government officials were pleading with people to take shelter from the dangerous Category 3 storm.
title: "Historic" Hurricane Beryl barrels toward Caribbean isles

description: Usher accepted the lifetime achievement award at the 2024 BET Awards, and Will Smith debuted a single as he continued his comeback from slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars two years ago​.
title: At BET Awards 2024 Usher honored, Will Smith debuts song, election on minds

description: Boeing announced plans to buy back the bulk of supplier Spirit AeroSystems for $4.7 billion, and Airbus said it would purchase Spirit operations related to the European aerospace giant.
title: Boeing, Airbus announce plans to buy parts of subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems

description: A murky law involving emergency protection orders leads to some judges allowing domestic abusers to keep their weapons.
title: Chicago mom was killed after abuser was allowed to keep his guns

description: Living comfortably means being able to pay all bills, afford a handful of wants and be able to save for the future.
title: Here's how much Americans say they need to earn to live comfortably

description: Simone Biles is heading back to the Olympics along with Jordan Chiles, Jade Carey, Hezley Rivera and Suni Lee.
title: U.S. Olympics gymnastics team set as Simone Biles secures third trip

description: First, a report on children living with veterans with PTSD. Then, a look at how some countries are accused of abusing the Interpol red notice system. And, a report on efforts to revive the extinct Tasmanian tiger.
title: 6/30/2024: Children of War; Interpol; Tasmanian Tiger

description:
First, Ukraine accuses Russia of looting museums. Then, how air systems can curb
viruses’ spread. And, a sports betting boom fuels addiction concern.
title: 6/30/2024: The Heritage War; The Air We Breathe; The Mismatch

description: Author and journalist Steven Brill joins "The Takeout" to discuss the real-world dangers of disinformation and his work to combat it. Brill discusses the importance of distinguishing fact from opinion, and whether truth can win out in the modern media landscape.
title: 6/30: The Takeout: Steven Brill

description: Celebrations across the country are marking the end of Pride Month. Advocates are using the opportunity to warn about Mpox in the hopes of avoiding a breakout similar to the one in 2022. Dr. Celine Gounder reports.
title: Advocates use end of Pride Month to warn about Mpox

description: Caretakers at George Washington's Mt. Vernon estate stumbled on nearly three dozen glass bottles filled with cherries and berries from the founding father's plantation. Scott MacFarlane has the story.
title: Caretakers make sweet discovery at George Washington's estate
